item.title: Faulty CrowdStrike update causes major global IT outage, taking out banks, airlines and businesses globally
item.description:
Security giant CrowdStrike said the outage was not caused by a cyberattack, as businesses anticipate widespread disruption.

item.title: Airport chaos around the world after global IT outage
item.description: Many flights have been grounded, with huge queues and delays at airports all over the world.

item.title: ‘Largest IT outage in history’ hits Microsoft Windows and causes global chaos
item.description:
Fault in CrowdStrike software update linked to Windows PCs may take days to fix, experts suggest

  • Microsoft outage: latest updates
  • What we know so far

A global IT failure has caused chaos at airports, banks, healthcare services and businesses around the world after a faulty software update caused “the largest IT outage in history”.

Microsoft’s Windows system was at the centre of the outage, after it was hit by a faulty software update from the US cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike that left large numbers of workers facing an error screen dubbed the “blue screen of death” as their computers failed to start. Experts said the recovery could take days because every affected PC may have to be fixed manually.

Continue reading...
